content: @Wesley Wiser @simulacrum so AFAIU from discussion above we should guide the submitted to use the RFC process for this change?
maybe we should split to a separate thread?
This topic was moved here from #t-compiler/meetings > [weekly] 2021-04-08 #54818 by simulacrum
I'm honestly a bit hesitant telling a first time contributor they need to write an RFC to make a 30 line change.
This feels to me like the "adding a new -C flag that exposes some minor variant" situation called out in the MCP RFC. So I think an MCP would be fine with an FCP signoff.

I do want to make sure we don't lose what @simulacrum mentioned in the triage meeting:

Yeah, I mean, I mostly want the answers to the background research / prior art section here :)
So I think that should be included.
@pnkfelix Do you think we need to ask for a full RFC for this or is an MCP with FCP signoff sufficient?
I think if MCP is sufficient, so is an FCP on the PR itself.
MCP seems like a process that is intended to invoke discussion on zulip.
Which doesn't feel like a goal here.
Also worth noting that this PR seems to be motivated by a FIXME/TODO comment previously present in the codebase.
An FCP on the PR itself may be fine. But do we have answers re background research / prior art?

nagisa said:

Also worth noting that this PR seems to be motivated by a FIXME/TODO comment previously present in the codebase.

Yeah, but those are often lacking a lot of context that one would need to evaluate whether a proposed solution is the right one
(The comment is also ancient, I suspect, possibly even pre-1.0)
